page.title: 02BURTON SALMON SUBSIDENCE
page.content: The worst case of subsidence in Brotherton is Mill Farm, which is just before the A1 and the end of our area. The trouble is coming from Glasshoughton Colliery and the shaft is only 200ft down so it is a shallow mine. Between the Christmas of 1983 and now, it has gone down 6-10ft. The barns and the farmhouse are in a state of collapse and are going to be knocked down next week before they fall down. Belmont Council Estate is also going to be knocked down, partly because of subsidence. The slip road onto the A1 has cracks 1cm wide and 1m deep. At the same site an 11,000 volt electric cable has bent. A bridge 30ft above ground level has also suffered and has been repaired.
